Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle with handle root; interior glazed (only traces remaining); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of animal procession with mere traces of glaze; swan's head and part of neck remaining, to left; part of two incised splinter rosettes and dot as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 99, no. A146)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.075) (Phase 1)
